# UD Xibe XDT

Language: [Xibe](/sjo/index.html) (code: `sjo`)<br/>
Family: Tungusic

This treebank has been part of Universal Dependencies since the UD v2.9 release.

The following people have contributed to making this treebank part of UD: He Zhou, Juyeon Chung, Elena Klyachko, Francis Tyers, Sandra Kübler.

Repository: [UD_Xibe-XDT](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Xibe-XDT)<br />
Search this treebank on-line: [PML-TQ](https://lindat.mff.cuni.cz/services/pmltq/#!/treebank/udsjo_xdt212)<br />
Download all treebanks: [UD 2.12](/#download)

License: CC BY-NC-SA 3.0

Genre: grammar-examples, news

Questions, comments?
General annotation questions (either Xibe-specific or cross-linguistic) can be raised in the [main UD issue tracker](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/docs/issues).
You can report bugs in this treebank in the [treebank-specific issue tracker on Github](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Xibe-XDT/issues).
If you want to collaborate, please contact [hzh1&nbsp;(æt)&nbsp;iu&nbsp;•&nbsp;edu].
Development of the treebank happens outside the UD repository.
If there are bugs, either the original data source or the conversion procedure must be fixed.
Do not submit pull requests against the UD repository.

|------------|--------|

| XPOS | not available |

## Description

The UD Xibe Treebank is a corpus of the Xibe language (ISO 639-3: *sjo*) containing manually annotated syntactic trees under the Universal Dependencies. Sentences come from three sources: grammar book examples, newspaper (Cabcal News) and Xibe textbooks.




The treebank was manually annotated for lemmas, universal part-of-speech, morphological features and dependency relations.


## Acknowledgments

If you use this treebank in your work, please cite:

}
</pre>

      <li>NUM: ᡠᡪᡠᡞ</li>
      <li>PART: ᠰᠠᡞ</li>
      <li>PRON: ᠪᡝᠶᡝᡞ, ᠮᡠᠰᡝᡞ, ᡨᡝᠷᡝᡞ, ᡨᡝᠰᡝᡞ, ᠰᡞᠨᡞ, ᠰᡠᠸᡝᠨᡞ, ᡞᠨᡞ, ᡠᠪᠠᡞ</li>

      <li>VERB: ᠣᡥᠣ, ᠰᡝᡥᡝ, ᡪᡞᡥᡝ, ᠨᡝᡞᡥᡝᠪᡞ, ᡪᡞᡥᡝᠪᡞ, ᠣᡥᠣᠪᡞ, ᠶᠠᠪᡠᡥᠠ, ᡞᠯᡞᡥᠠᠪᡞ, ᡞᠴᡞᡥᡞᠶᠠᡥᠠᠪᡞ, ᡤᡝᠨᡝᡥᡝ</li>
      <li>VERB-Conv: ᡩᡠᠯᡝᡥᡝᡣᡡ</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin: ᠰᡝᡥᡝ, ᠣᡥᠣ, ᠨᡝᡞᡥᡝᠪᡞ, ᡪᡞᡥᡝ, ᡪᡞᡥᡝᠪᡞ, ᠣᡥᠣᠪᡞ, ᡞᠴᡞᡥᡞᠶᠠᡥᠠᠪᡞ, ᡤᡝᠨᡝᡥᡝ, ᠰᠠᠷᡞᠪᡠᡥᠠᠪᡞ, ᠶᠠᠪᡠᠪᡠᡥᠠ</li>
      <li>VERB-Part: ᠪᡠᡥᡝ</li>
      <li>VERB-Vnoun: ᠠᡫᠠᠪᡠᡥᠠᡣᡡᡢᡤᡝ</li>

<h2>Syntax</h2>

<h3>Auxiliary Verbs and Copula</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 2 lemmas as copulas (<a>cop</a>). Examples: ᠣᠴᡞ, ᠣᠮᠪᡞ.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 4 lemmas as auxiliaries (<a>aux</a>). Examples: ᠨᡞᡢᡤᡝ, ᠪᡞᠮᠪᡞ, ᠰᡝᠮᠪᡞ, ᠪᡞ.</li>
</ul>

<h3>Core Arguments, Oblique Arguments and Adjuncts</h3>

Here we consider only relations between verbs (parent) and nouns or pronouns (child).
<ul>
  <li><a>nsubj</a>
    <ul>
      <li>VERB--NOUN (26)</li>
      <li>VERB--NOUN-ADP(ᡞ᠋) (1)</li>
      <li>VERB--PRON (12)</li>
      <li>VERB-Conv--NOUN (139)</li>
      <li>VERB-Conv--NOUN-ADP(ᠨᡞ) (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Conv--NOUN-ADP(ᠪᡝ) (2)</li>
      <li>VERB-Conv--PRON (39)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN (171)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN-ADP(ᠪᡝ) (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON (139)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON-Gen (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--NOUN (84)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--NOUN-ADP(ᠨᡞ) (3)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--NOUN-ADP(ᠪᡝ) (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Part--NOUN-ADP(ᡞ) (3)</li>

<h3>Verbs with Reflexive Core Objects</h3>

<ul>
  <li>This corpus contains 1 lemmas that occur at least once with a reflexive core object (<a>obj</a> or <a>iobj</a>). Examples: ᠠᡣᡡ ᠪᡝᠶᡝ</li>
</ul>

<h3>Relations Overview</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 9 relation subtypes: <a>acl:relcl</a>, <a>flat:name</a>, <a>mark:adv</a>, <a>mark:plur</a>, <a>mark:rel</a>, <a>nmod:poss</a>, <a>nsubj:pass</a>, <a>obl:lmod</a>, <a>obl:tmod</a></li>
<li>The following 7 relation types are not used in this corpus at all: <a>expl</a>, <a>dislocated</a>, <a>list</a>, <a>orphan</a>, <a>goeswith</a>, <a>reparandum</a>, <a>dep</a></li>
</ul>
